title: Lesson 96
paragraph: This lesson focuses on sound and silence, emphasizing resonance, timbre, and harmony.

words.meaning: the quality in a sound of being deep, full, and reverberating
words.example: The resonance of the bell filled the hall.
The cave amplified the reverberation of their voices.

words.meaning: the character or quality of a musical sound or voice
words.example: The singer has a rich timbre.

words.meaning: a sound with reference to its quality, pitch, or strength
words.example: He spoke in a gentle tone.

words.meaning: the quality of being deep, full, or rich in sound
words.example: The orchestra achieved a great sonority in the finale.

words.meaning: lack of harmony among musical notes; tension or clash
words.example: The composer used dissonance to create tension.

words.meaning: the combination of simultaneously sounded musical notes to produce a pleasing effect
words.example: The choir sang in perfect harmony.

words.meaning: a modulation or inflection of the voice; rhythm
words.example: The speaker's cadence was calm and measured.

words.meaning: a temporary interval of quiet or lack of activity
words.example: There was a lull in the storm.

words.meaning: the absence of movement or sound
words.example: The stillness of the night was peaceful.
